analysisInProgress.message: Analysis in progress. Start browsing on the current tab, then come back here to get stats !

autoscrollPercentInput.message: Enter % to scroll for page's analysis

autoscrollPxInput.message: Enter pixels number to scroll for page's analysis

betaMessage.message: This feature is a beta version, errors may occur.

csvColumnsLabel.message: Date;Url;Uncompressed size(b);Compressed size(kb);DOM;GES Data Center(gCO2e);GES Network(gCO2e);GES User(gCO2e);GES Total(gCO2e); GES Score; Grade; Country; CarbonIntensity; NumberRequest

deleteAllConfirmMessage.message: Do you really want to delete all history ?

errorNoToken.message: No CO2 token found, the extension may not work

infoMix.message: Your emissions depend on the energy mix of the country in which you are located, and in which the website is hosted. This energy mix can vary from hour to hour and season to season:

menuText.message: GreenTrackR is install in your browser and accessible via the devtool panel (F12 or CMD + ALT + i sur Mac)

descriptionResults.message: The scroll, click and total (scroll + click) actions are presented in 5 columns, with, for each, the number of hits, the weight, the queries, the greenhouse gases, the score, and finally the KPI'S.

descriptionResultsAnalysis.message: Parameters are presented in 5 columns: date, URL, event, page weight and number of HTTP requests. Greenhouse gas emissions are shown in 6 columns, broken down into emissions for the server, network, devices, total, score and rating. Water, ADP and electricity consumption are broken down into 4 columns: server, network, devices and total. This is followed by the client and server columns, divided into 2 columns for zone and intensity, and finally the action column.

messageResultsDetail.message: Detailed table of user journey analysis

descriptionResultsDetail.message: Parameters are presented in 5 columns: date, URL, event, page weight and number of HTTP requests. Greenhouse gas emissions are shown in 6 columns, broken down into emissions for the server, network, devices, total, score and rating. Water, ADP and electricity consumption are broken down into 4 columns: server, network, devices and total. This is followed by the client and server columns, divided into 2 columns for zone and intensity.

paramRetryDescription.message: Set the maximum number of attempts to avoid errors in computing HTTP requests for the websites you want to analyze.

paramTokenCo2Description.message: GreenTrackR uses the 'CO2signal' API from Electricity Maps. To use this API, you need an access token, you can get it on the following link 'Go to api portal' ->
